div1.p: Pinto informs Truby that his manuscript is well written and compatible with the facts.

div1.head: Letter from A. S. Pinto to Albert E. Truby, September 7, 1941
div1.p:
Your manuscript is here
and I should have notified you before so you
would not worry if it was not forthcoming soon.

It is so beautifully and well written and so
compatible with all the facts that any changes
by me would be presumptious, however I shall
suggest a few alterations.

Do not be alarmed if I do not send it back right
away as I am as usual very busy and aside from
keeping Omaha well as Health Com. I do some private
practice and any spare time I have to examine
draftees as this is the third army I have taken
the job of examining hundreds and thousands of
men selected for service.

Spanish American, World War 1 and this one what
call it I do not know however I call it the new de
Deal War.

Shall write you more fully soon but at present want
you to know I was reading your manuscript and e
enjoying every paragraph of it.

It will be a valuable contribution to future
generations to read just what was done in this
very important contribution to medicalx science.
div1.closer:
Best Regards till later ASP. A, S. P.
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
RALPH PRINTING COMPANY
JACKSON 2166
